candidates.title: Update `heapless` to 0.9.1, `rand_core` to 0.9.3, `defmt` to 1.0.1, `env_logger` to 0.11.8
candidates.body:
Just some dependency updates, nothing spectacular.
Also fixes some warnings and errors I hit in `main`.

CC @obabec

candidates.title: chore: update dependencies, switch to stable Rust, and update readme
candidates.body:
- Switch to stable Rust 1.75.
- Add MSRV section in README.md, documenting compatibility with stable Rust 1.75+.
- Update Cargo.toml dependencies: `embedded-io-adapters`, `env_logger`, `serial_test`.

The crate builds and all tests (unit, integration and load) pass.

Is there anything else I can do to help with the release?

candidates.title: fix: fix warnings and update deps and toolchain
updated embedded-io to v0.6.1
candidates.body:
* embedded-io was recently moved to https://github.com/rust-embedded/embedded-hal and updated

I just changed some imports and removed async feature as there is embedded-io-async now.

candidates.title: Make QOS and retain part of the publish API, add raw client, fix clippy warnings, update e-io version
candidates.body: This is a set of improvements we developed when working with rust-mqtt. The most notable one is the raw client which helps with out of order message reception - see the commit message for more details.
